page.title: 06TRAFFIC IN SALTCOATS
page.content: The town gets very little through traffic by road as an alternative route inland exists _ the{"High Rd". The{main railway line}to{Largs}runs through the town and there is a lot of disruption because this line is being {electrified,}involving the raising of all the bridges to accommodate the cables. The railway is therefore safe from closure - it also serves Ardrossan harbour and links with the{ferries there. The town is well served by{car-parks although the recent{pedestrianisation (see page 5) has increased pressure on parking areas. A new{one-way road {system}has been introduced.
